title: Practices
paragraphs: We are healing the world. We care for ourselves so we can help others step out of colonial metronomes and into the rhythms immanent around us. Practices are contextual: greeting or bidding farewell to the sun; honoring new and full moons, equinoxes and solstices; and other rituals. We embrace syncretic paths.

Practices also include land stewardship, communal meals, housing co‑ops, and collective celebrations. Alone we are a line; together we become a tesseract within the tesseract, stronger and holding endless tensions.

subpractices.name: Morales
subpractices.desc: Shared liberation music and performances to mark times of victory and defeat.

subpractices.name: Prisons
subpractices.desc: Resisting domination of time by reclaiming felt time.

subpractices.name: Development
subpractices.desc: Fortitude beyond resilience — sharing and creating housing, skills, and meals.

subpractices.name: Eras
subpractices.desc: A future beyond resilience already exists in cosmic fabric — immanent though outside immediate perception.

subpractices.name: Territories
subpractices.desc: Zapatistas, Rojava, the Cop City resistance, Standing Rock — places of immanent tesseract practice.
